item.title: 蒙特利尔银行首席执行官称美国经济正在改善，并称加州为 "具有战略意义的重要市场
item.description: 蒙特利尔银行（Bank of Montreal）负责人表示，美国经济正显示出比预期更强劲的增长迹象，而加利福尼亚州是一个具有战略意义的重要市场，该银行已在其南部邻国迅速扩张。【原文：The U.S. economy was showing signs of stronger than expected growth, with California being a strategically important market, said the head of Bank of Montreal , which has rapidly expanded in its southern neighbour.】

item.title: Smartmatic 与 One America News 就选举诽谤诉讼达成和解
item.description: Smartmatic 已就指控右翼电视网络 One America News 谎称该投票技术公司操纵 2020 年美国总统大选以帮助乔-拜登击败唐纳德-特朗普的诽谤诉讼达成和解。【原文：Smartmatic has settled a lawsuit accusing right-wing television network One America News of defamation by falsely claiming that the voting technology company rigged the 2020 U.S. presidential election to help Joe Biden beat Donald Trump.】

item.title: 受税收外流和国债供应影响，美国融资利率小幅上升
item.description: 本周美国短期融资成本略有上升，原因是与税收有关的资金外流以及为财政部发债融资的现金需求，但市场参与者表示，没有迹象表明存在更广泛的流动性问题。【原文：U.S. short-term funding costs rose slightly this week due to tax-related outflows and demand for cash to finance the Treasury's debt issuance, but market participants said there was no indication of broader liquidity issues.】

item.title: 耶伦称释放俄罗斯资产价值对援助乌克兰很重要
item.description: 美国财政部长珍妮特-耶伦（Janet Yellen）周二表示，美国及其七国集团（G7）盟国正在继续探索一系列可能性，以释放被冻结的近3000亿美元俄罗斯资产的价值，从而援助乌克兰。【原文：The U.S. and its Group of Seven (G7) allies are continuing to explore a range of possibilities to unlock the value of nearly $300 billion in frozen Russian assets to aid Ukraine, U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 拜登政府与各州合作保护航空公司客户
item.description: 美国交通部长皮特-巴蒂吉格（Pete Buttigieg）周二宣布与各州检察长合作，快速调查针对航空公司和机票代理商的投诉，这是拜登政府加强消费者保护工作的一部分。【原文：U.S. Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg on Tuesday announced a partnership with state attorneys general to fast-track investigations into complaints against airlines and ticket agents as part of the Biden administration's efforts to enhance consumer protections.】

item.title: 花旗为首的大型银行在削减成本的压力下继续裁员
item.description: 美国银行业巨头在第一季度继续裁员，其中花旗集团的裁员幅度最大。【原文：U.S. banking giants continued to shed employees in the first quarter, with Citigroup seeing the biggest drop.】

item.title: 穆迪称，2023 年美国企业违约中，惯犯占 40
item.description: 根据信用评级机构穆迪（Moody's）的最新报告，在 2023 年拖欠债务的美国公司中，约有 40% 以前曾拖欠过债务。【原文：Around 40% of U.S. companies that defaulted on their debt obligations in 2023 had previously done so, according to a new report from credit ratings agency Moody's.】

item.title: 阿迪达斯第一季度业绩强劲，上调盈利指引
item.description: 体育用品公司阿迪达斯在第一季度业绩好于预期后，周二上调了 2024 年的盈利指导。【原文：Sporting goods company Adidas on Tuesday raised its 2024 earnings guidance after a better than expected performance during the first quarter.】

item.title: 华尔街老板欢呼投资银行业收益，但仍保持谨慎
item.description: 华尔街的老板们终于看到了投资银行业务广泛回暖的迹象，但他们还没有大声欢呼。【原文：Wall Street's bosses are finally seeing signs of a broader pickup in investment banking, but they are not cheering too loudly just yet.】

item.title: 独家报道：消息人士称，汉莎航空新的 ITA 补偿措施与之前的差别不大
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士说，汉莎航空对收购 ITA Airways 股份采取的新补救措施与欧盟反垄断监管机构之前否决的方案没有明显区别，欧盟反垄断监管机构在审查该交易时也没有将瑞安航空视为竞争对手。【原文：Lufthansa's new remedies on its ITA Airways stake buy are not markedly different from an earlier package rejected by EU antitrust regulators which have also discounted Ryanair as a rival in its scrutiny of the deal, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 奢侈品市场放缓，LVMH 集团第一季度销售额增长率降至 3
item.description: 本周二，LVMH 集团公布第一季度销售额增长 3%，但增速放缓，原因是价格上涨促使更多渴望拥有其手袋和其他奢侈品的购物者暂缓花费数千美元。【原文：LVMH reported a 3% rise in first quarter sales on Tuesday, marking a slowdown as rising prices prompted more shoppers who aspire to own its handbags and other luxury goods to hold back on splashing out thousands of dollars.】

item.title: 耶伦称中国清洁能源产品生产过剩需要缓解
item.description: 美国财政部长珍妮特-耶伦（Janet Yellen）表示，中国对清洁能源产品先进制造业的大规模投资导致了不公平的竞争环境，使美国工人和企业面临风险，这种情况需要得到缓解。【原文：U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said that China's massive investments in advanced manufacturing of clean energy goods has resulted in an unfair playing field that puts U.S. workers and businesses at risk, and it needs to be mitigated.】

item.title: 俄罗斯油轮集团首席执行官称美国制裁影响了 Sovcomflot 的贸易能力
item.description: 俄罗斯顶级航运集团 Sovcomflot 的负责人周二表示，随着华盛顿加强对莫斯科的制裁，美国的制裁限制了该公司的油轮活动。【原文：U.S. sanctions are limiting tanker activity for Russia's top shipping group, Sovcomflot, the company's head said on Tuesday, as Washington tightens the screws on Moscow.】

item.title: 唐纳德-特朗普的债券提供商为自己的帮助辩护
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普的纽约民事欺诈案中为其提供 1.75 亿美元保证金的公司表示，该公司具有 "实质性的财务信誉"，并拒绝了该州总检察长关于该公司没有资格提供帮助的建议。【原文：The company that provided Donald Trump with a $175 million bond in his New York civil fraud case said it had "substantial financial credibility," and rejected a suggestion by the state's attorney general that it wasn't qualified to provide help.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织警告 "软着陆 "中的金融风险依然存在
item.description: 国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）警告市场不要过度繁荣，因为投资者期待中央银行在长达数年的通胀之战中实现 "软着陆"。【原文：The International Monetary Fund is cautioning against overexuberance in markets as investors look for central bankers to pull off a "soft landing" in their years-long inflation battle.】

item.title: 美国 3 月制造业产出增长；2 月数据上修
item.description: 由于汽车装配厂和其他工厂的产量上升，3 月份美国工厂的生产稳健增长，这表明制造业在受到借贷成本上升的制约后正在出现转机。【原文：Production at U.S. factories increased solidly in March as output at motor vehicle assembly plants and elsewhere rose, suggesting that manufacturing was turning the corner after being constrained by higher borrowing costs.】

item.title: 解说员：美国药房福利管理公司为何受到抨击？
item.description: 药房福利管理公司（PBM）是美国国会共和党和民主党的矛头所指，但迄今为止，该公司一直躲避着任何新的诉讼或改革，而上个月的美国政府预算协议曾将这些改革列为目标。【原文：Pharmacy benefit managers (PBMs) are in the crosshairs of Republicans and Democrats in Congress but have so far dodged any new litigation or reforms that had been targeted for inclusion in last month's U.S. government budget deal.】

item.title: 杰斐逊称，如有必要，美联储可在更长时间内保持货币紧缩政策
item.description: 美联储副主席菲利普-杰斐逊（Philip Jefferson）在周二的讲话中只字未提降息，他表示，如果通胀未能如预期般放缓，"将目前的限制性政策立场维持更长时间将是合适的"。【原文：Federal Reserve Vice Chair Philip Jefferson, in remarks devoid of any mention of interest rate cuts, said on Tuesday "it will be appropriate to hold in place the current restrictive stance of policy for longer" if inflation fails to slow as expected.】

item.title: Stellantis 股东批准首席执行官塔瓦雷斯 2023 年薪酬方案
item.description: Stellantis 股东周二批准了支付给汽车制造商高层管理人员的薪酬，其中包括支付给首席执行官卡洛斯-塔瓦雷斯（Carlos Tavares）的价值高达 3,650 万欧元（3,880 万美元）的薪酬。【原文：Stellantis shareholders on Tuesday approved the compensation paid to the carmaker's top management, including a package worth up to 36.5 million euros ($38.8 million) for CEO Carlos Tavares.】

item.title: 耶伦称美国正努力降低全球经济面临的风险
item.description: 美国财政部长珍妮特-耶伦（Janet Yellen）周二表示，强于预期的美国经济增长为全球经济提供了动力，华盛顿正在努力减轻全球前景面临的剩余风险，并确保可持续的长期增长。【原文：U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen on Tuesday said stronger-than-expected U.S. economic growth had helped power the global economy, and Washington was working to mitigate remaining risks to the global outlook and ensure sustainable long-term growth.】

item.title: AMD 推出面向商用笔记本电脑和台式机的人工智能芯片
item.description: 先进微设备公司（Advanced Micro Devices）周二发布了一系列新的人工智能个人电脑芯片，以扩大其在利润丰厚的 "人工智能个人电脑 "市场的份额。【原文：Advanced Micro Devices unveiled a new series of chips for artificial intelligence-enabled personal computers on Tuesday as it looks to expand its share of the lucrative "AI PCs" market.】

item.title: 北方信托因出售债务投资受挫，利润下滑
item.description: 资产与财富管理公司北方信托周二公布，第一季度利润下降了 38%，原因是出售部分债务投资的亏损抵消了服务和管理客户资产的费用收入增加所带来的收益。【原文：Asset and wealth manager Northern Trust posted a 38% fall in first-quarter profit on Tuesday as a loss on the sale of some debt investments offset gains from higher fee income for servicing and managing client assets.】

item.title: 初创公司 Rivos 融资 2.5 亿美元开发 RISC-V 人工智能芯片
item.description: 芯片初创公司 Rivos 周二表示，它在一轮融资中筹集了 2.5 亿美元，这将使它能够生产首款面向人工智能的服务器芯片。【原文：Chip startup Rivos said on Tuesday it raised $250 million in a funding round that will enable it to manufacture its first server chip geared for artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织认为 2024 年全球经济增长缓慢而稳定；中国和通胀构成风险
item.description: 国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）周二表示，全球经济又将迎来缓慢但稳定增长的一年，美国的强劲势头将推动世界经济产出克服持续高通胀、中国和欧洲需求疲软以及两场地区战争外溢效应等不利因素。【原文：The global economy is set for another year of slow but steady growth, the International Monetary Fund said on Tuesday, with U.S. strength pushing world output through headwinds from lingering high inflation, weak demand in China and Europe, and spillovers from two regional wars.】

item.title: 美国 3 月份独户住宅开工率大幅下降
item.description: 尽管住房需求依然强劲，但抵押贷款利率的回升正将潜在购房者推向观望。【原文：U.S. single-family homebuilding tumbled in March after hefty gains in the prior month, and while demand for housing remains strong, a resurgence in mortgage rates is pushing potential buyers to the sidelines.】

item.title: 斯里兰卡未能与债券持有人就重组条款达成一致
item.description: 斯里兰卡政府周二表示，该国未能与债券持有人就约 120 亿美元的债务重组达成协议，这使该国满足国际货币基金组织（IMF）计划要求的计划变得更加复杂。【原文：Sri Lanka has failed to strike an agreement on restructuring about $12 billion of debt with its bondholders, the government said on Tuesday, complicating the nation's plans to meet the requirements of an IMF programme.】

item.title: 调查显示，美国小型制造商热衷拜登的大型工业计划
item.description: 美国的中小型制造商可能正在热衷于拜登政府推行的积极工业政策。【原文：America’s small and mid-sized manufacturers may be warming up to the Biden administration’s push for an aggressive industrial policy.】

item.title: 投资银行业务复苏，摩根士丹利利润上升
item.description: 摩根士丹利第一季度利润增长，主要得益于投资银行业务的复苏。【原文：Morgan Stanley's profit rose in the first quarter, lifted by a resurgence in investment banking.】

item.title: 利息收入减少，PNC 利润下降 21
item.description: PNC 金融服务公司周二公布的第一季度利润下降了 21%，原因是在高利率环境下，该贷款公司为持有客户存款支付了更多费用，导致利息收入减少。【原文：PNC Financial Services reported a 21% fall in first-quarter profit on Tuesday, hurt by lower interest income as the lender paid more to hold customer deposits in a high interest rate environment.】

item.title: 美国银行利润因客户利息支出减少而下降
item.description: 美国银行第一季度利润下降，原因是其消费部门走弱，贷款机构注销了更多贷款，尤其是信用卡贷款。【原文：Bank of America's first-quarter profit fell as its consumer division weakened and the lender wrote off more loans, particularly for credit cards.】
